Detailed description of Bugshaw


At the top of a small hill is the road Thrahak Road. Near it is The Town Square


Along Finelien's Square is The Markets


At the bottom of a hill is Main Street. Nearby is Marked Liquid


Along Wells Row is Doughy Delights

Down from Doughy Delights is The Dependable Barter


Strongheart Crescent houses Ashburn Grave


Nearby is Pope Street, and nearby is The Famed Fabricator


Along Baker Road is The Hibiscus Bush Herb Shop


Nearby is the lane Noble Plaza. Along it is The Wise Gold Smith


At the bottom of a hill is Duke Road, and nearby is Sew New


Further towards the centre of Bugshaw is Autumn Street. Nearby is The Bugshaw Boot Shop


At the top of a small hill is the street Gunnloa Street. Nearby is the bordello Rusty's Cutlass


Further out of the hamlet is Smith Trail, where there is The Quick Hair


At the top of a small hill is the road Common Crescent. On it is The Church of Consecrated Souls
town:
The Hamlet of Bugshaw

Bugshaw is a hamlet located in the arid mountains, where the vegetation is lush. Bugshaw grew around a well-traveled crossroads, and is comprised . They are a patriarchal capitalist sophocratic constitutional monarchy that .

The nearest landmark is Morla’s Daughter: In the middle of a swamp is a lone mountain with a small town at the top. There is something weird about the tortle settlement that leads visitors to think they are hiding something…even the mountain is shaped like a turtle shell. A population of 547, the denizens live a modest existence. A new moon is currently taking place.

Government in Bugshaw

The people of Bugshaw work in exchange for payment from their employers, which they use to buy the necessities. Mr Whurbin Fire-Forge is the head of state, but affairs are handled by The Brotherhood of Knowledge Holders, the head of whom is Ms Eridred Durthane.

Economics

Trade is reasonable in Bugshaw, and people live a modest existence because of it; some taxes are applied to certain goods and services that are rendered in the city, but the more creative entrepreneurs can find loopholes to make a better profit. Welfare is above average, considering the modest quality of life. Citizens can expect a decent education, provided they can pay for it. Healthcare is overtaxed and underfunded, though.

Law and Order

The policing presence in Bugshaw is more of a militia; some of the members of The Truncheon of Bugshaw are part time, and there is little need for the use of force outside of intruders. Law in Bugshaw is very much punitive based, and those that breach the laws can expect hard labor, incarceration, or sometimes public execution. Crime is an ugly stain on humanity, to be punished. Magic has not been codified into the laws.

Racial Demographics
Bugshaw is comprised mostly of dwarves.

313de281-ff30-4147-931b-1853af52a0f5.name: The Town Square
313de281-ff30-4147-931b-1853af52a0f5.output:
You're in the town square. It's relatively large, and somewhat dirty. It features an old, withered cypress tree. Legend says that it will flower on the darkest day of the land, to give the people hope. As you pass through, you see a dwarf with a rather wild, unkempt beard who is running through the square.

There's a beggar who waves his alms cup at you weakly. There's also a noticeboard, which has various posters, requests, and announcements tacked to it.

8d8166e3-d5fa-448e-b30a-107dca99ee86.name: The Markets
8d8166e3-d5fa-448e-b30a-107dca99ee86.output:
You wander through the streets of Bugshaw, and come across the market, which is located in a series of small buildings connected by covered awnings. It seems that the vendors are organised by nothing; the place is a big disorganized mess. The market is known for the entertainers and musicians set up around the bazaar, and is riddled with the refuse of merchant horses and other livestock. Today the market is fairly packed, and people are bustling about and jostling each other to get to certain merchants.

Merchants

Off to the side, a obese female dwarf is shouting out "Never lose another bet! Get yourself some rigged dice! Buy it now!" from a handful of crates or chests the vendor has set up.

A prime adult aged man with big, floppy ears is selling hardy slaves (laborers) from a ramshackle storefront.

Nearby, a prime adult aged lizardfolk with a blazing gaze is saying loudly "Scabbards with monsters getting stabbed on them! Scare them before you even start! Best price in all the lands!" from a flimsy wooden booth.

Off to the side, a early middle aged halfling with a narrow ribcage is selling silk shirts and scarves from a hammock the vendor has set up.

b3f8adaa-4019-491e-8219-dcdc1e86c745.name: Marked Liquid
b3f8adaa-4019-491e-8219-dcdc1e86c745.output:
You enter Marked Liquid, a shabby hewn rock apothecary with a white tiled roof. Looking around, Marked Liquid must have had an explosion the day before; there is no other possible reason that a shop that deals with magical, often volatile chemicals would be so cluttered, crowded, and blatantly a danger to itself and the half-mile radius surrounding it. There are pots and pans of mixtures that have already spilt over crowding the desk, with potions that are currently brewing strewn around the floor. There's little hope to walk through the shop without putting your boot in something that you probably would prefer not to put it in. Just as you try and hesitate, you hear the distinct sound of 'no, please don't go!' come from the floorboards, which at first seemed to be sticky, but on closer inspection, was more... 'grabby'. There is a chemist behind the shop counter currently mashing up herbs with a pestle frantically.

Chemist

a very tall man with very rounded ears looks at your eyes intently, and then smiles, and welcomes you when you come inside. He introduces himself as Antonyr Underwood, the proud owner of the shop, and asks what he can do for you.

Antonyr Underwood
Antonyr looks amused, and idly shifts a box of amanita cap as he talks. The very tall man tries to push various products on you all as you look about the shop as you peruse the shop. Antonyr tells you that he is working on a component for a polymorphing hex, and points to the thick glass pot. Looking inside the pot, you see a thick and sludgy pale green liquid with translucency bubbling away.
Generate a random potion!
Potion of Age
The potion is in a glass syringe, and has a label showing several different names and descriptions plastered over each other. It looks light grey with a constant heat. It is thin and watery and smells of music but tastes of bacon.
The potion's strength is temporary, but strong and wears off quickly, and makes the user grow some years older.
Marked Liquid's Potions and Wares
Antonyr Underwood smiles, and says "What are you after? We can do just about anything you could possibly need; salts, herbs, gengko bush, ephedra, arrow root, you name it! Things might be a wee bit more expensive than you're used to, but that's the cost of doing business at the moment."

b2d7ac9d-896f-4317-bc85-7a88316b7428.name: Doughy Delights
b2d7ac9d-896f-4317-bc85-7a88316b7428.output:
You enter a shabby brick pastry shop with a decently built straw roof called Doughy Delights. You notice a small black cat darts behind the counter as you enter.

This pastry shop is known for having once been owned by a famous hero. There is a rather round female dwarf with long, thick earlobes currently prepping some oranges for baking. She welcomes you, and asks what you are after.

Unleavened bread 4 Copper
Stale bread 3 Copper

5e983d12-24d0-4b0d-b891-fe0895549501.name: The Dependable Barter
5e983d12-24d0-4b0d-b891-fe0895549501.output:
You make your way down Wells Row, and enter a shabby hewn rock general store with a blue tiled roof and see that inside, the quite large building is dangerously messy. The front counter is cluttered with wooden practice swords. You notice some of the items on sale here are oddly magical (or non-magical). The store's shopkeep is currently locking up a case that looks to be full of maps.

Shopkeeper

The shopkeep nods at you when you come up to the counter. She introduces herself as Penelope West, the owner of the General Store, and warns you that she is down to her last hatchet. Penelope insists she is from an ancient line of powerful merchants.

Buy something

Penelope West smiles, and says "What are you after? We can do just about anything you could possibly need; cups, cups, spoons, you name it! Be warned, these prices might be... out of your range"

585c6515-6dc5-4e1c-b9c0-9ef0a8e41a09.name: Ashburn Grave
585c6515-6dc5-4e1c-b9c0-9ef0a8e41a09.output:
Ashburn Grave is chiseled into an enormous glacier and was built as a later addition. It is known for being haunted by vengeful ghosts, and consists of organized around a large central cell block or pit. It is rumoured that hidden inside the dungeon is the preserved head of an ancient villain.

Cells

The cells inside the dungeon are aging, but sturdy; the walls have some cracks, and prisoners are kept in cells that accommodate up to two prisoners, each shackled to the wall.

Prisoners of Ashburn Grave are treated like dogs; they receive poor quality meals and enough healing to keep them alive. The jailer, Gillydd Gorunn, is a haunted woman who applied to job to ulitmately free their lover, only for them to die before she had the chance.

Meet a prisoner
Fonkin, a small man with a narrow jawline that arrows into a pointed chin who had too much to drink, and committed a minor crime.
Name Race Occupation Relationship
Gillydd Gorunn Dwarf Jailer Jailer
Fonkin Maekkelferce Gnome Peasant Prisoner

5f855fcf-984b-4cb2-a420-b961b684c987.name: The Famed Fabricator
5f855fcf-984b-4cb2-a420-b961b684c987.output:
You make your way down Pope Street, and enter The Famed Fabricator and see that inside, the shabby hewn rock farrier shop with a straw roof is cavernous. The smithy is fastidious, with a swept floor and tools stored neatly on the walls. There's a desk in the corner with a piece of parchment showing the current project's measurements, and the materials are neatly stored in bins. Clearly, whatever apprentice has been charged with upkeep of the smithy has taken their job very seriously. You can see that activity in The Famed Fabricator is very busy. There is a blacksmith currently sweating profusely from exertion.

On the bench lies a lance. It's obviously amateurish. Alvyn moves around the shop, unsure of himself, betraying his lack of skills.

Blacksmith

The blacksmith grunts in your direction when you walk in after finishing with another customer. He introduces himself as Alvyn Gimlen, the proprietor of the smithy, and asks what he can do for you.


Alvyn Gimlen
Alvyn looks distracted, and while you chat, he moves around the shop, preparing a new project for work. Alvyn finds working in the The Famed Fabricator boring, and says that the patrons of The Famed Fabricator are fine, but rather dull.


You chat for a while, and then Alvyn says "I recently forged a halberd for a local noble, but I don't have time to bring it to her. Would you be willing to take it to her for me? I would pay you for your troubles of course."

Buy something

"I'm not sure what you might find of interest- just a bunch of horseshoes and nails. Be my guest, though." The somewhat squat male gnome with colorfully painted nails says, apparently well aware that the smithy isn't exactly doing too well.

a6319684-6fc2-489b-988c-3efac85097ca.output:
You come inside The Hibiscus Bush Herb Shop, a shabby hewn rock building with a decently built straw roof. You notice a table with vases of all shapes and sizes set in the middle of the room.

This botany shop is known for creating beautiful art out of the petals that fall off their flowers. There is a quite squat man with fingers like sausages currently trimming the stems on a few cut hibiscuses. He welcomes you, and asks what you are after.

e3a37436-de29-4f29-8ce7-59ea1c1832e2.name: The Bugshaw Boot Shop
e3a37436-de29-4f29-8ce7-59ea1c1832e2.output:
You come inside a shabby hewn rock shoemaker shop with a decently built straw roof called The Bugshaw Boot Shop. You notice several finely made paintings of shoes hanging on different walls.

This shoemaker shop is known for mostly making shoes for women. There is a somewhat short male half-orc currently helping a customer try on a nice pair of leather boots. He welcomes you, and asks what you are after.

Goods Cost
Short boots 1 Silver
High boots 1 Silver 5 Copper
Heeled shoes 1 Silver
Dress shoes 2 Silver 5 Copper
Shoe repair 1 Silver

c27da45c-e3b7-4c1d-9b9c-a2a941d1d9b5.name: Rusty's Cutlass
c27da45c-e3b7-4c1d-9b9c-a2a941d1d9b5.output:
You make your way down Gunnloa Street, and enter Rusty's Cutlass a shabby hewn rock building with a decently built straw roof. Inside, the huge hewn rock building is fastidious. You notice several pieces of pottery with very vulgar acts painted on them. When people talk about Rusty's Cutlass, they say you can pay for the services offered with criminal favors. Apparently, it specialises in discrete service for high end clientele. Rumours abound in whorehouses, and Rusty's Cutlass is no different; apparently, all the beds are infested with bedbugs.

Brothel Mistress

The Mistress is pouring over a book titled The Complete Works of Archilochus, she appears to be a large madam with a no-nonsense attitude. As soon as you enter the dwarf sizes you up, before she nods at you, and trudges over to where you are. She introduces herself as Artin Battlehammer, the Mistress of Rusty's Cutlass, and asks what she can do for you.

This harlot is a young foreigner called Bolhild Bloodkith. She has long slender hands and is particularly good at cooking and cleaning. However, she has dirty, matted hair, which is well-concealed by make-up or practice. She is looking to hear word of a child given away.
Customers
Name Race Occupation Relationship
Artin Battlehammer Dwarf Pimp Pimp
Bolhild Bloodkith Dwarf Harlot Worker

f246891d-24dd-4fd6-b8ec-083800cc1a7c.name: The Quick Hair
f246891d-24dd-4fd6-b8ec-083800cc1a7c.output:
You open the door to The Quick Hair, a hewn rock building with a decently built thatched roof. You notice a variety of different glass vials and bottles full of shaving oils.

This surgery is known for never drawing blood during a shave. There is a rather small woman with nails sharpened to a point currently starting to doze off in a corner of the shop. She welcomes you, and asks what you are after.

9421eee5-6a99-4648-9a39-2b8bfa69e9c1.name: The Church of Consecrated Souls
9421eee5-6a99-4648-9a39-2b8bfa69e9c1.output:
You come across a shabby hewn rock church with a thatched roof. This church is protected by sellswords.

You enter the large, rather messy church and notice a kneeler beneath a small statue or icon. The main room is octagonal in shape and is decorated with mostly wealthy looking holy art. The interior walls of the church are actually the hollowed husk of an enormous tree and the the ceiling is connected to the floor by columns. The church was designed by a renowned theologian of the clergy and it is arranged in a concentric fashion; the inner areas are inaccessible to most visitors.

Within this holy place they pray to one god, but not the one the temple was originally dedicated to. The temple itself was originally dedicated to friendship and community and is known for dancing monks.

Priest

A temple priest is currently placing some nice smelling incense in an old looking incense holder. The priest greets you, and introduces himself as Erias Eversharp. He informs you the temple has confessionals open if you wish to confess.

Blessing

The priest raises his hand above you and mumbles some words in a language you do not understand. You are told by the priest that you are now blessed with a depth of feeling that was locked deep within you.

leader.name: The Brotherhood of Knowledge Holders
leader.output:
The Brotherhood of Knowledge Holders is a scholars guild. It's new, and the very small faction has an excellent reputation, and is motivated by fame. They are rumoured to own a powerful artifact.

Governance

It's ruled by Eridred Durthane, who was the most charismatic of the group. She is reasonably competent, and her position is stable due to internal power struggles. Bribes are sometimes accepted.

Members

Members of The Brotherhood of Knowledge Holders are identifiable by the ring that members are given. Membership requires referral by an existing member, and costs a single gold piece. The initiation into The Brotherhood of Knowledge Holders involves a simple form to be filled.

Relationships
Name Race Occupation Relationship
Eridred Durthane Dwarf Professor Head of Faction

Resources

They have limitless resources. A handful of debtors are in their proverbial warchest, as are one or two valuable magical weapons, a significant number of gems, a handful of magical trinkets, and sheafs of magic scrolls.

Politics

The Brotherhood of Knowledge Holders have a handful of trusted allies;
A guild of craftsmen and more than a couple rangers can be called on for aid. The Brotherhood of Knowledge Holders have more enemies than one would expect; A guild of bandits wish ill of The Brotherhood of Knowledge Holders. Their other enemies also include a guild of priests, and a guild of bandits.

4e9d6125-84a4-4466-9afc-1656f996e113.name: The Bugshaw Poems
4e9d6125-84a4-4466-9afc-1656f996e113.output:
The Bugshaw Poems is a bards college. It's relatively new, and the miniscule faction has an excellent reputation, and is motivated by fame. They are against the current political regime.

Governance

It's ruled by Kildrak Holderhek, who was the strongest of the group. He is somewhat incompetent, and his position is very unstable due to conflicts with rivaling factions. Bribes will be met with laughter.

Members

Members of The Bugshaw Poems are identifiable by the ring that members are given. Membership requires a display of skill, and costs ten gold pieces. The initiation into The Bugshaw Poems involves a secret ritual.

Relationships
Name Race Occupation Relationship
Kildrak Holderhek Dwarf Bard Head of Faction

Resources

They have quite poor resources. A handful of magical trinkets and a drawer of blackmail material are their only significant resources.

Politics

The Bugshaw Poems have few allies;
A large number of priests are the only others they can rely on. The Bugshaw Poems have some enemies; A guild of bandits and a guild of bandits are the only that wish The Bugshaw Poems ill.

7702d28c-f33e-4da7-9b2d-073eea621f26.name: The Collective of Memorized Evokers
7702d28c-f33e-4da7-9b2d-073eea621f26.output:
The Collective of Memorized Evokers is a wizards college. It's ancient, and the quite small faction has an excellent reputation, and is motivated by vengeance. They are rumoured to own a powerful artifact.

Governance

It's ruled by Orsik Silverstone, who was able to rise to power through nepotism. He is of mild incompetence, and his position is stable due to internal power struggles. Bribes are sometimes accepted.

Members

Members of The Collective of Memorized Evokers are identifiable by the sash that members are given. Membership requires some social status, and costs three hundred gold pieces, provided there's an empty slot. The initiation into The Collective of Memorized Evokers involves an oath to be taken.

Relationships
Name Race Occupation Relationship
Orsik Silverstone Dwarf Wizard Head of Faction

Resources

They have significant resources. A drawer of magic scrolls are jealously guarded, as are a handful of favours, a handful of gems, and a handful of debtors.

Politics

The Collective of Memorized Evokers have few allies;
A veritable army of bandits are the only others they can rely on. The Collective of Memorized Evokers have some fearsome enemies; A guild of assassins are rivals. Other enemies include a guild of seers, a guild of assassins, and a guild of priests.

a30067a9-e4b7-44a7-bf1e-aa74c832fe11.name: The Truncheon of Bugshaw
a30067a9-e4b7-44a7-bf1e-aa74c832fe11.output:
The Truncheon of Bugshaw is a guards watch. It's recently established, and the quite small faction has an excellent reputation, and is motivated by money. They are rumoured to be under investigation.

Policing

Bugshaw is policed by The Truncheon of Bugshaw, rather than a separate guard. The guard is underfunded, and their equipment is always in slight disrepair. Their officers are held accountable for their actions when public pressure fors for it, though The Truncheon of Bugshaw does not have the funding to perform training exercises.
One can recognise a member of The Truncheon of Bugshaw by the dark grey and white livery adorned with an image of an octopus.


Law in Bugshaw

Law in Bugshaw is very much punitive based, and those that breach the laws can expect hard labor, incarceration, or sometimes public execution. Crime is an ugly stain on humanity, to be punished.

Governance

It's ruled by Taklinn Ironfist, who was able to rise to power by completing an ordeal. He is quite competent, and his position is relatively stable due to internal power struggles. Bribes are sometimes accepted.

Members

Members of The Truncheon of Bugshaw are identifiable by their love of a good fight. Membership requires some social status, and costs twenty gold pieces. The initiation into The Truncheon of Bugshaw involves a simple form to be filled.

Relationships
Name Race Occupation Relationship
Taklinn Ironfist Dwarf Fighter Head of Faction

Resources

They have extensive resources. A significant number of gems are in their proverbial warchest, as are a handful of contacts, a handful of magic scrolls, and a handful of magical weapons.

Politics

The Truncheon of Bugshaw have some strong allies;
A veritable army of knights and a veritable army of merchants can be called on for aid. The Truncheon of Bugshaw have some fearsome enemies; A guild of assassins wish ill of The Truncheon of Bugshaw. Their other enemies also include a guild of thieves, a guild of bandits, and a guild of assassins.

33dd9ac4-862f-4ba4-a45d-f28a0832ae59.name: Travok Frostbeard
33dd9ac4-862f-4ba4-a45d-f28a0832ae59.output:
/tɹɑvʌk fɹɔstbɪɹd /.

Travok Frostbeard is an early middle aged male dwarf. He is quite squat and quite large, and has brown eyes and a rather wild, unkempt beard, with brown skin. The most notable physical trait of Travok is that he has a ring of thorns tattoo.

Travok sweats profusely and easily. He is temperate and slow to believe in people. When he is relaxed, he is reserved. In moments of stress, he becomes stubborn. Religion-wise, Travok is an outspoken believer.

Perhaps due to sexism, Travok has recently been slightly unsuccessful as a squatter, with a background of being a peasant. He belongs to the paupery social class.

Travok currently has 7 sp in his pockets, and 50 Gold 1 Silver 9 Copper to his name. He lives on Duke Road. Travok knows Common and Dwarvish. He primarily prefers other genders, but sometimes finds the same gender attractive

Travok currently earns 1 Silver 3 Copper per day.
Finances
Type Amount
Gross Income 1 Silver 5 Copper

Net Income 1 Silver 3 Copper
Total Lifestyle Expenses (squalid) 1 Silver 1 Copper
Profit 2 Copper
Money owed by Whurbin Fire-Forge107 Gold 1 Copper
Early Life
I was born in a temple, and was raised by my mother and father as an only child. I had a squalid upbringing in an apartment in a rundown neighborhood. Others saw me as different, or strange, and so I had few companions.
Becoming a squatter
" I've had a bit of a downturn as a squatter. If it keeps up for much longer, I'm going to begin losing hope. Hedonism. Life is going to be short, so I will do whatever I can to make my life filled with visceral pleasures."
Life Events
Well, I certainly have a tale or two...When I was younger, while I was still a kid I got lost in a cypress tree forest for half a year at least. I was found by a city guard but I still get lost from time to time. Later in my life, to pay off a debt, I had to work as a squatter.

748556c0-9087-4dd7-9194-ee75c3570e85.name: Whurbin Fire-Forge
748556c0-9087-4dd7-9194-ee75c3570e85.output:
/wɝbɪn undefinedundefined /.

Whurbin Fire-Forge is a middle aged male dwarf. He is quite squat and built like a brick shithouse, and has blue eyes and a long, flowing beard, with fair skin. The most notable physical trait of Whurbin is that he has a rather bony chin.

Whurbin has poor hygiene. He is subjective. When he is relaxed, he is dour. In moments of stress, he becomes destructive. Religion-wise, Whurbin is an open-minded seeker of Artemis.

Perhaps due to sexism, Whurbin is a noble, with a background of being a noble. He belongs to the nobility social class.

Whurbin currently has 12 sp and 7 gp in his pockets, and 510 Gold 6 Silver 1 Copper to his name. He lives on Thrahak Road. Whurbin knows Common and Dwarvish.

Whurbin currently earns 2 Gold 5 Silver 7 Copper per day.

Early Life
I was born on an Inner Plane, and was raised by my mother and father, along with my 2 siblings. I had a wealthy upbringing in a large house. I had a few close friends, and my childhood was a relatively normal one.
Becoming a noble
"My family has been disgraced, and I intend to restore our once pristine reputation. I earnt my place as a noble, working tirelessly day in, day out. Nothing is more important that the other members of my family. It is my duty to respect the authority of those above me"
Life Events
Well, I certainly have a tale or two...This one time to pay off a debt, I spent some time as a noble. After that, I was caught aiding and abetting the crime of counterfeiting, but due to being under a spell, I was found not guilty.Oh, and I can't forget the time because of a promise, I did some time as a noble. I was a chorus member in a regional musical. The audience never seemed all too impressed with my performance.How could I ever forget the time I worked as a noble. You might not believe it, but there was no other work so for a while I was a noble. Oh, and I can't forget the time I was a guest in the court of a lord, and made an embarrassment of him- I'll freely admit that I'm to blame. I couldn't care less if he tries to do anything about it. Because of a promise, I did some time as a noble.There was this one time, to pay off a debt, I spent some time as a noble. At one point, I worked as a noble.

09fc91a8-73db-42b4-9590-420aa14a05cd.name: Garur Morigak
09fc91a8-73db-42b4-9590-420aa14a05cd.output:
/ɡɹɝ mɔɹʌɡʌk /.

Garur Morigak is a middle aged male dwarf. He is quite squat and quite large, and has gray eyes and a dreadful beard, with pale skin. The most notable physical trait of Garur is that he has a chunk of right ear missing.

Garur often sniffs audibly. He has a severe underbite. When he is relaxed, he is fearful. In moments of stress, he becomes secretive. Religion-wise, Garur is a critical student of Zeus.

Garur is a gambler, with a background of being a peasant. He belongs to the peasantry social class.

Garur currently has a compass in his pockets, and 80 Gold 2 Silver 9 Copper to his name. He lives on Smith Trail. Garur knows Common and Dwarvish. Garur has a wife, Hdeth Torunn.

Garur currently earns 1 Gold 2 Silver 2 Copper per day.

Early Life
I was born in the home of a friend, and was raised by my single father as an only child. I had a poor upbringing in a rundown shack. Others saw me as different, or strange, and so I had few companions.
Becoming a gambler
" I'm working as a gambler. The work is alright, if a little dull Survival. Everything I do is to ensure I will see another sunrise."
Life Events
Well, I certainly have a tale or two...This one time there was a small war between a rival lord that I was forced to take part with. I suffered some serious injuries, and had to be carried off the field. One time I was caught and convicted of arson, and spent 1 years in jail before being released. I forget exactly when, but at one point, because of a promise, I did some time as a gambler. I met the love of my life, [object Object]. At one point, my friends and I went on a long journey to a city of elves nestled inside a mountain range. I got lost along the way and never made it there, but I have not given up.

156f232b-b2cc-4238-8e75-1cc65ec4d273.name: Resh Rangakk
156f232b-b2cc-4238-8e75-1cc65ec4d273.output:
/ɹɛʃ ɹæŋɡʌk /.

Resh Rangakk is an old male half-orc. He is medium sized and thin, and has yellow eyes with pale skin. The most notable physical trait of Resh is that he has a narrow, sunken chin.

Resh exaggerates details. He is perky, merciless, and fearless. When he is relaxed, he is confident. In moments of stress, he becomes pushy. Religion-wise, Resh is a quiet true believer.

Despite sexism against him, Resh has been having mild success as a gambler, with a background of being a hermit. He belongs to the peasantry social class.

Resh currently has a potion of Polymorph Self worth 350gp in his pockets, and 150 Gold 7 Silver 1 Copper to his name. He lives on Noble Plaza. Resh knows Common and Orc.

Resh currently earns 1 Gold 2 Silver 2 Copper per day.

Early Life
I was born in a temple, and was raised by the orphanage as an only child. I had a poor upbringing in a very impressive house. I didn't know my parents growing up. Others saw me as different, or strange, and so I had few companions.
Becoming a gambler
"I never liked the people that I grew up with, so it was easy for me to leave it all behind and strike out a new life, alone. I'm on the upswing as a gambler. Things are looking better. I entered seclusion to hide from the ones who might still be hunting me. I must someday confront them. I believe that meddling in the affairs of others only causes trouble."
Life Events
Well, I certainly have a tale or two...This one time I apprenticed under Brottor Bigtoe a mediocre candlemaker. During that time my master taught me many things. Early Life
I was born among people of a different race, and was raised by my mother and father as an only child. I had a squalid upbringing in no real permanent address. I had a few close friends, and my childhood was a relatively normal one.
Becoming a prisoner
"I resented authority in my younger days, and I saw a life of crime as a way to get back at those that I thought had wronged me. I'm on the upswing as a prisoner. Things are looking better. Someone I loved died because of a mistake I made. That will never happen again. I believe in honour amongst thieves- I don't steal from others in the trade."
Life Events
Well, I certainly have a tale or two...This one time I apprenticed under Urshar Foamtankard a master cook. During that time I realized I could never match my master. Oh, and I can't forget the time I went to find a sheep that had gone missing, and must have gotten lost- I ended up in a strange land, where the colours were not as they should have been. I eventually found my way back, but never found the missing sheep. It turned up, completely skeletised in my bed three days later. There was this one time, I went on a pilgrimage with a group to the birthplace of my god. I had waited my whole life for this, but I sacrificed much to finish the trip. After that, I was falsely accused of extortion, but eventually was acquitted. It took up years of my life, though, and I still get antsy around guards that I don't know.Not to mention there was the time I once settled down near a temple of wizards.How could I ever forget the time I met the love of my life, who is no longer with me. At one point there was no other work so for a while I was a prisoner. Oh, and I can't forget the time I met a man, and we played cards. He decided that I was cheating- I suppose that I'm at least partially to blame. I couldn't care less if he tries to do anything about it. At one point, I made an enemy for life in my travels- I'll freely admit that I'm to blame. I doubt I'll ever meet him again.

The snake spoke to us and said a miracle would befall us soon, but one of us did not believe them. The next week, everyone in town had sprouted long thick beards, even the women. How could I ever forget the time I worked as a noble. At one point I set off on a pilgrimage by myself to a holy landmark of my god. I had waited my whole life for this, but I do not feel any more enlightened from the experience. One time one time, I was part of a real curse. Early Life
I was born in a tavern, and was raised by my extended family as an only child. I had a poor upbringing in no real permanent address. I had a few close friends, and my childhood was a relatively normal one.
Becoming a candlemaker
"After a charlatan fleeced my family, I decided to learn all the tricks I could so I would never fall for another scam. I've had trouble as a candlemaker. I guess some people are born with it- I'm sure as hell not. I fleeced the wrong person, a lord called Ericus, and must work to ensure that he never crosses paths with me or those I care about. I believe that Material goods come and go. Bonds of friendship last forever."
Life Events
Well, I certainly have a tale or two...This one time in my army days I was awarded a medal for brutality.I have no idea where it is these days and I don't really care. There was this one time, I met a famous crime boss when I was spending some time as a charlatan. There was this one time, I made an enemy for life in my travels- I'm ashamed to admit that I'm to blame. I would rather have backup the next time that I face him. Not to mention there was the time I saw a demon I swear on my life! Sometimes I think it is still hunting me.There was this one time, for a while I did some work as a charlatan. Not to mention there was the time I met a man, and we played cards. He decided that I was cheating- I'm not quite sure what happened. I don't exactly care to run into him again.Once I had the pleasure of attending the royal wedding of a local noble. I forget exactly when, but at one point, there was a pretty nasty zombie outbreak which I had to defend my town against. I managed to survive, but I still have nightmares about what happened. Not to mention there was the time I spent some time working as a charlatan.There was this one time, I was falsely accused of arson, but eventually was acquitted. It took up years of my life, though, and I still get antsy around guards that I don't know. At one point, because of a promise, I did some time as a candlemaker.

Early Life

Becoming a peasant
"I followed a childhood friend into religious service because we made a pact to never be apart. I'm doing really well as a peasant! Maybe it's luck, maybe a natural talent, I don't know. Everything I do is for the common people. I hope to one day rise to the top of my faith's religious hierarchy."
Life Events
Well, I certainly have a tale or two...When I was younger, for a while I did some work as a acolyte. Later in my life, I was ensorcelled by a fey for a year. It played tricks on my mind, making me see things which were not there, and not see things which were there.

Well, I certainly have a tale or two...This one time I was falsely accused of theft, but eventually was acquitted. It took up years of my life, though, and I still get antsy around guards that I don't know. Once I came across a famous historian while on a long journey. Oh, and I can't forget the time because of a promise, I did some time as a soldier. Once I apprenticed under Vonbin Goblinbane a fallen actor. During that time my master was gentle with their teachings. Not to mention there was the time I did a stint as a soldier.There was this one time, there was no other work so for a while I was a gravedigger. Oh, and I can't forget the time I went on a holy journey to see the holiest relic of my people. I had waited my whole life for this, and my peers have respected me more since I returned. One time I once saw a true curse. My town was told by a passing prophet that a miracle was coming, and I was the only one who did not believe them. That night, monsters descended upon our town. How could I ever forget the time I went on a pilgrimage with a group to the floating island of a god. I had waited my whole life for this, but in the end I'm not sure if it was worth it. At one point, I struck out heading towards the still-burning carcass of an ancient behemoth in a red sand desert. I really did make it there, and I made some new friends along the way.

Well, I certainly have a tale or two...When I was younger, I was framed by a scoundrel for a crime I didn't commit- I'm ashamed to admit that I'm to blame. I'm afraid that he'll kill me in my sleep. Later in my life, while I was still a kid I got lost in a willow tree forest for a few days. I eventually found a city guard but I still get lost from time to time.

Roywyn is melodramatic. She is foolhardy. When she is relaxed, she is foolish. In moments of stress, she becomes caustic. Religion-wise, Roywyn is a casual observer of Aphrodite.

Perhaps due to sexism, Roywyn is currently slightly unsuccessful as a meteorologist, with a background of being an acolyte. She belongs to the commoner social class, but lives lavishly, with fine foods, wines, clothes, and all the comforts money can buy.

Early Life
I was born at home, and was raised by my single father as an only child. I had a wealthy upbringing in a rundown shack. Others saw me as different, or strange, and so I had few companions.
Becoming a meteorologist
"My family gave me to a temple, since they were unable to care for me. I've had a bit of a downturn as a meteorologist. If it keeps up for much longer, I'm going to begin losing hope. I will do anything to protect the temple where I served. I hope to one day rise to the top of my faith's religious hierarchy."
Life Events
Well, I certainly have a tale or two...This one time I did a stint as a acolyte. After that, when I was young I got lost in a blue spruce tree forest for days. I was found by my relative and have carried a compass ever since.To pay off a debt, I spent some time as a meteorologist.I met up with an adventurer who generously gave me a Drunkard's Chime of Healing.

Drunkard's Chime of Healing

The bearer always knows the direction to the closest alcoholic beverage. This item contains 4 weak healing nodes. As an action, a character can use one node to heal 1d4 hit points at touch range. The item regains 1d4 charges at sunrise.
I'll always remember the time I struck out heading towards the still-burning carcass of an ancient behemoth in an incredibly hot desert. I never got to see that place, but I came out of the journey a better person. Once one time, I was part of a real curse. My town was told by a passing prophet that a miracle was coming, but one of us did not believe them. That night the lost souls of our town rose from the dead and ransacked us. There was this one time, for a while I did some work as a acolyte. At one point while I was travelling through a black spruce forest, I saw an ent! I got pretty close to it before it ran off. At one point I had a child, Sindri Daergel with my dear partner, who is no longer with me. At one point, there was a pretty nasty zombie outbreak which I had to defend my town against. I suffered some serious injuries, and had to be carried off the field.

Once I once saw a true miracle. My friends and I once came upon a snake who was trapped beneath a rock and we helped it out. After that, to pay off a debt, I spent some time as a hermit.Once while I was still a kid I got lost in a forgotten city below the ground for a few hours. I was found by a panicked wizard but not before I was roughed up by some bandits I ran into. Oh, and I can't forget the time I was framed by a scoundrel for a crime I didn't commit- I'll never say what really happened. I'm afraid that he'll kill me in my sleep. Life Events
Well, I certainly have a tale or two...This one time I went on a holy journey to a distant shrine. I had waited my whole life for this, but my god did not speak to me in my travels. I shook the hand of a passing noble. If I recall their handshake was ice cold.To pay off a debt, I spent some time as a gladiator.How could I ever forget the time for a while I did some work as a gladiator. At one point there were some goblin raids which I had to defend my town from. I suffered only minor injuries, and the wounds all healed without leaving any scars. After that, there was a civil war within the town that I fought in. I acquitted myself well in battle, and was awarded a medal for bravery.At one point when I was young I got lost in a sycamore tree forest for months. Bear up, my child, bear up; Zeus who oversees and directs all things is still mighty in heaven.Sophocles

Zeus , God of the Sky, is the god of thunder and lightning, kings, and fate . His symbol is a fist full of lightning bolts. Zeus is the leader of the Greek gods, and lives atop Mount Olympus, where he rules over the mortal world below. Zeus is depicted as a regal, mature man with a sturdy figure and dark beard grasping a lightning bolt and wreathed in a crown of olive leaves. Zeus resides in Olympus, where he rules over all. He is a leader in the pantheon. He is Neutral.

Poseidon.name: Poseidon
Poseidon.output:
Poseidon , God of the Sea and Earthquakes, is the god of earthquakes, floods, and horses . His symbol is an A trident and billowing cloak. Poseidon is the god of the Sea - all things underwater are under his purview a mature man with a sturdy build and a dark beard holding a trident and a sea-creature encrusted boulder, simply crowned with a headband with a cloak draped around his arms. Poseidon resides in a palace underneath the sea, watching over the fishermen from below. He is a greater deity in the pantheon. He is Chaotic Neutral.

Powers

Blessings

Smooth Sailing

Poseidon will bless sailors and those that have earnt his favour with smooth passage.

Management of Horses

As the Lord of Horses, Poseidon can calm equines as easily as he can enrage them.

Curses

Mad Horses

As the Lord of Horses, Poseidon can enrage equines as easily as he can calm them.

Stormy Seas

Those that tempt Poseidon's wrath risk stormy seas on their next voyage.

Possessions

Poseidon's Trident

Poseidon's trident was so powerful that it could shake the lands.

Followers

Poseidon makes up % of worshipped deities in Bugshaw. Poseidon is followed by many mariners, fishermen, and horse riders. In combat, his followers favour the trident. Clerics of Poseidon are typically of the tempest domain.

Hades.name: Hades
Hades.output:
Hades , God of the Dead, is the god of the dead, funeral rites, and fertile soil . His symbol is a Helm of Hades. Hades is the god of the Dead and the first son of Kronos. However when He, Zeus and Poseidon were drawing lots for the division of the cosmos, Hades gained dominion of the Underworld, where he rules over the dead. a dark-bearded, regal god, with a bird tipped sceptre with Cerebus seated by his throne. Hades resides in the Underworld. As far below the earth as the heavens are above, Hades' realm is a dark and depressing place. He is a greater deity in the pantheon. He is Lawful Evil.

Powers

Blessings

Plenty from the Earth

As the lord of the underworld, Hades has considerable wealth, and can bestow riches to those he deems worthy.

The Ability to Go Un-Noticed

Hades can give those that wish to be unseen the power to avoid detection in the dark.

Possessions

Sceptre

A powerful relic that is able to create a passage between the worlds of the living and the dead

Cap of Invisibility

A cap which can turn the wearer invisible

Followers

Hades makes up % of worshipped deities in Bugshaw. Hades, as the god of the dead, was a fearsome figure to those still living; in no hurry to meet him, they were reluctant to swear oaths in his name, and averted their faces when sacrificing to him. Since to many, simply to say the word "Hades" was frightening, euphemisms were pressed into use. Clerics of Hades are typically of the death and grave domains.

Aphrodite.name: Aphrodite
Aphrodite.output:
Aphrodite , The Deviser, is the goddess of lovers, lust, and beauty . Her symbol is a dove. Aphrodite is the goddess of love and scorns those who stay away from relationships. Her love can be a thing of beauty or a thing of terror and destruction. Aphrodite is consistently portrayed as a nubile, infinitely desirable adult, having had no childhood. She is a greater deity in the pantheon. She is Chaotic Good.

Beauty.

Blessings

The Girdle inspires desire in all those who look upon the wearer

Followers

Artemis.name: Artemis
Artemis.output:
Artemis , Goddess of the Hunt, is the goddess of the wilderness, wild animals, and chastity . Her symbol is a bow and quiver of arrows. Artemis is the goddess of the Hunt and young girls. She can change others into animals as punishment for transgressions against her and she demands appropriate respect from mortals. a young woman wearing a short costume that leaves her legs free and wielding a bow with a quiver of arrows. She is a greater deity in the pantheon. She is Neutral Good.

Apollo.name: Apollo
Apollo.output:
Apollo , Of the Oracle, is the god of prophecy, healing, and plague . His symbol is a lyre. The twin brother of Artemis, Apollo is the inventor of music. Those that he loves and loses or those that he hates can find themselves transformed and immortalised as a part of nature. a handsome youth, beardless with long hair and holds either a lyre or a bow. He is a greater deity in the pantheon. He is Neutral.

Powers

Possessions

The Lyre of Apollo

When Hermes was a baby, he stole a number of Apollo's Cattle and took them to a cave in the woods near Pylos. In the cave, he found a tortoise and killed it, then removed the insides. He used one of the cow's intestines and the tortoise shell and made the first lyre.
Apollo eventually found Hermes, but fell in love with the sound the lyre made. Apollo gifted the cattle to Hermes in exchange for the lyre and forgave Hermes for stealing his cattle.

Bow of Apollo

The bow of Apollo fires arrows and plagues upon those who anger him

Followers

Apollo makes up % of worshipped deities in Bugshaw. Oracles are often followers of Apollo, the Greatest of which is the Pythia of Delph, the high priestess of Apollo Clerics of Apollo are typically of the light, knowledge, and life domains.

Dionysus.name: Dionysus
Dionysus.output:
Dionysus , Of the Bacchic Frenzy, is the god of vegetation, pleasure, and madness . His symbol is a Thyrsus. Dionysus is the god of Wine and Theatre, his revelry is open to all. However, he has his dark side - he is the god of madness the anger of Dionysus is a terrifying thing long haired youth, almost effeminate in appearance. He holds a staff topped with a pinecone and brings revelry with him He is a greater deity in the pantheon. He is Chaotic Neutral.

Powers

Followers

Dionysus makes up % of worshipped deities in Bugshaw. Dionysus is a god of the people and youths. Those who value proper decorum and modesty are apallled at the revelry of the Bacchic crowds. Devotees of Dionysus may engage in the rending of animals with their bare hands Clerics of Dionysus are typically of the nature, life, and trickery domains.

Demeter.name: Demeter
Demeter.output:
Demeter , Of the Grain, is the goddess of grain and bread, the Eleusinian mysteries, and fertility . Her symbol is a cornucopia. Demeter is the goddess of Agriculture - her favour promised a bountiful harvest and more grain then could be eaten. However her anger promised frosts and famine. a mature woman wearing a crown holding wheat in a cornocopia and a torch She is a greater deity in the pantheon. She is Neutral Good.

Powers

Bountiful harvest, satiated appetite, and a better afterlife.

Blessings

Followers

Demeter makes up % of worshipped deities in Bugshaw. As the goddess of Agriculture, Demeter has a dedictated following among anyone who farmed. She was also a major figure of worship in the Eleusinian mysteries, which promised a better afterlife to its followers. In combat, her followers favour the Sickle. Clerics of Demeter are typically of the life domain.

Hermes.name: Hermes
Hermes.output:
Hermes , Keeper of the Flocks, is the god of boundaries, animal husbandry, and hospitality . His symbol is a Caduceus . Hermes is the hessenger of the gods and the personal messenger of Zeus. He brings the souls of the deceased to the edge of the underworld, where they are ferried deeper by the Cthonic gods an athletic man wearing winged boots, full of energy. Ontop of his head is a helmet with two wings attached. He is a greater deity in the pantheon. He is Chaotic Good.

Powers

Possessions

Talaria

Tarlaria is the name of a pair of winged boots forged by Hephaestus.

Golden Blade

His weapon was a sword of gold, which killed Argos; lent to Perseus to kill Medusa.

Winged Helm

A Petasos with wings, Hermes' helmet was forged by Hephaestus.

Followers

Hermes makes up % of worshipped deities in Bugshaw. Hermes was the messenger of Zeus, and his followers were all those that valued speed. Additionally, travelers, traders, and thieves worshiped him. Clerics of Hermes are typically of the trickery, peace, and grave domains.

Ares.name: Ares
Ares.output:
Ares , Who rallies men, is the god of battlelust, courage, and brutality . His symbol is a spear. always clad in armour, holding weapons and ready for battle. He can appear as the fresh-faced youth or the grizzeled veteran depending on his mood. He is a greater deity in the pantheon. He is Chaotic Evil.

Powers

Odikinesis

Possessing the ability to manipulate feelings and emotions of war such as hate and rage, Ares would induce strife before battles.

Strength

As a fighter, Ares excelled at all to do with physicality.

Followers

Ares makes up % of worshipped deities in Bugshaw. Ares is the god of war and courage - cities and countries going to war would worship Ares before going into battle Clerics of Ares are typically of the war domain.
